results.title: A State funeral for Alec Campbell: the last Anzac
results.creator_credit: Tracey Smith, ABC-TV (Australia) and Greg Simson
results.brief_description: Described as charming, determined but also quite humble, a man of peace, widely respected and with many friends, Alec Campbell (1899-2002) was affectionately remembered as the last Anzac. He was born in Launceston, Tasmania, educated at Scotch College, Launceston and at the tender age of sixteen, successfully enlisted (by lying about his age) in the Army, in the 15th Battalion headed for Gallipoli. His time spent in Gallipoli was very brief - 2 months as a water carrier, but Alec has become part of the Anzac legend, however reluctantly, and on his passing on 16 May 2002 was given the honour of a State funeral as the last Anzac who fought in Gallipoli. This video is of the television broadcast of Alec Campbell’s State Funeral Service which was held at the Cathedral Church of Saint David in Hobart, Tasmania on Friday 24 May 2002. Hosted by Judy Tierney, Peter Gee and Lt. Col. John Moore, the program begins with a portrait of Alec Campbell’s life and achievements through interviews with his family and including stills, archival newsreel footage and family photos. This is then followed by a complete broadcast of the funeral service. A great tribute to a man who perhaps was somewhat bewildered by all the fuss and attention he received in his final years - a gentle man.

results.title: A Star named Ayrton Senna
results.creator_credit: Jean-Claude Guiter, Instituto Ayrton Senna and FOCA
results.brief_description: A Star Named Ayrton Senna is an insightful and intimate documentary about the Brazilian Formula 1 Champion who died tragically in May 1994. Includes interviews with Senna’s relatives and friends as well as people he worked with in the Grand Prix circuit. Fans of Ayrton Senna the man and also Formula One will enjoy the many frank interviews with Senna, as well as footage of him racing (including his days of racing Go-Carts!) and also his normal life away from the Grand Prix hysteria. Senna’s views on life and his professionalism are beautifully presented and the documentary also gives an interesting insight into the stresses and strains of fame. In English and Portugese with English subtitles.

results.title: A Star is lost
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Smith, Daisy Bellefeuille and John Howe
results.brief_description: A musical comedy feature about the trials and tribulations of making an old-time musical spectacular a la Busby Berkeley era of MGM. Take an inexperienced studio head, add a villainous competitor, an eccentric director, and an exquisite star who has never sung a note in her life, and you’ve got problems! But they’re nothing to compare with the situation once your exquisite star … is lost.

results.title: A Star is born [Streisand]
results.creator_credit: Jon Peters, Time-Warner, First Artists, Barwood Films and Frank Pierson
results.brief_description: This third version of the classic Hollywood story of success and failure, exhilaration and despair, takes place against the high pressure background of big-time rock and roll. Barbra Streisand and Kris Kristofferson play the two lovers whose paths intersect but cannot parallel. For him, it’s too late to start over. For her it’s too early to slow down.

results.title: A Star is born [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David O. Selznick, Warner Bros Pictures and William Wellman
results.brief_description: The rise of a small-time singer to Hollywood stardom is matched by the decline of her actor-mentor, then husband. A melodrama, a musical comedy and a musical-within-a-musical which, beneath its mythmaking about Hollywood, achieves a rare depth of emotion and sense of truthfulness. Cast includes Janet Gaynor, Frederic March, Adolphe Menjou and May Robson.

results.title: A Star is born
results.creator_credit: Sid Luft, Warner Bros Pictures, Transcona Enterprises and George Cukor
results.brief_description: A powerful musical re-make of the 1937 classic and one of Judy Garland’s greatest hits. She plays a successful wife and actress while her husband (James Mason) sinks in the opposite direction.

results.title: A Star is born
results.creator_credit: Cine Service and Standard Motor Products Ltd
results.brief_description: The story of the Vanguard Spacemaster with long low lines, an impressive front end and new body panels that give new and bigger doors. Special features of the external bodywork, the chassis, engine, internal fittings and actual performance on the road are illustrated.

results.title: A Stamp is born
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Australian postage stamps; the initial work of artists and master engravers; examination of the first proof copies; the preparation of plates used in the printing processes, the making of special printing inks; inspection of the finished product. The film concludes with views of important postal issues.

The film concludes with views of important postal issues.

results.title: A Stake in the soil
results.brief_description: This video aims to increase awareness of the soil and its importance to mankind. It describes the development of soil science, and the history of the American Prairie and the Russian Steppe. Soil science owes much to Vasilii Dokuchaev, a professor of mineralogy at the University of St Petersburg who, in the 1880’s, became intrigued by the idea of soil as a living medium. ‘A Stake in soil’ follows Dokuchaev’s work, travelling to America where awareness was sharpened by the ‘dustbowl’ events in the 1930’s. The program also briefly covers the natural forces which impact on soil; wind and water erosion and drought, and the farming techniques that have contributed to this burden, such as the removal of fences and trees as windbreaks, deep ploughing and excessive animal grazing.
